cards.title: Lootcase
setup: At the start of the game, {Lootcase} enters play “Cunning Cat Burglar“ side up.
gameplay: The first time {Lootcase} would be dealt damage each turn, prevent that damage.
At the start of the villain turn, if the total loot value of all case cards in play is more than $1,500,000, {Lootcase} flips.
At the end of the villain turn, play the top card of the villain deck.
cards.advanced: At the start of the game, one “Yoink!“ is put into play.  The villain deck is shuffled.
flippedGameplay: Reduce damage dealt to case cards by 1.
Increase damage dealt by villain targets by 1.
At the start of the villain turn, if the total loot value of all case cards in play is equal to or less than $1,500,000, {Lootcase} flips.
At the start of the villain turn, if the total loot value of all case cards in play is more than $3,500,000, {Lootcase} wins.
At the end of the villain turn, play the top card of the villain deck.
cards.flippedAdvanced: Whenever a case card is destroyed, {Lootcase} deals each hero target 1 projectile damage.
cards.challengeText: At the start of the villain turn, if the total loot value of all case cards in play is more than $3,000,000, {Lootcase} wins.

openingLines.default: Just one big score and then I'm out.  For real, this time.
openingLines.TheWraithCharacter: Ah, stately Montgomery manor.  Let's see what treasures you have waiting for me.
openingLines.LazyFanComix.TheWraithImprovisedGearChar: I don't see why you want these trinkets back so badly.  You can always make more.

cards.title: Collector's Item
body: When this card enters play, search the Villain trash for a card named “Yoink!“ and put it into play.
The loot value of this card is $300,000.

cards.title: Gold Bars
body: At the end of the villain turn, {Lootcase} deals the 2 hero targets with the highest HP {H - 1} melee damage each.
The loot value of this card is $400,000.

flavorQuotes.text: Feels like I got hit by a ton of bricks!

cards.title: Shiny Jewels
body: At the end of the Villain turn, this card deals each Hero target 2 radiant damage.
The loot value of this card is $400,000.

cards.title: Family Heirlooms
body: At the end of the Villain turn, destroy {H - 2} equipment cards.
The loot value of this card is $500,000.

cards.title: Priceless Antiques
body: If this card would be dealt 3 or more damage, redirect that damage to the Hero target with the highest HP.
The loot value of this card is $600,000.

cards.title: Masterpiece
body: At the end of the Villain turn, {Lootcase} regains 5 HP.
The loot value of this card is $700,000.

flavorQuotes.text: I find great art so soothing.

cards.title: One Million Dollars
body: At the end of the Villain turn, all Case cards regain {H - 1} HP.
The loot value of this card is $1,000,000.

flavorQuotes.text: And it's tax free, to boot!

cards.title: Beloved Childhood Memento
body: At the end of the Villain turn, the Hero with the lowest HP deals themself {H} psychic damage.
The loot value of this card is $1.

cards.title: Bought-Off Guard
body: At the end of the Villain turn, play the top X cards of the Villain deck, where X equals the number of Environment cards in play.

flavorQuotes.text: It helps to have friends in{BR}the right places.

cards.title: Forged Appraisal
body: Multiply the loot value of all Case cards by 2.

flavorQuotes.text: I have the paperwork right here.

cards.title: Hidden Vault
body: When this card enters play, reveal cards from the top of the Villain deck until a Case card is revealed.  Put the Case into play and move this card next it.  Shuffle the other revealed cards into the Villain deck.
This card and any card it is next to are indestructible.

flavorQuotes.text: I'll save this for a rainy day.

cards.title: Yoink!
body: At the end of the Villain turn, each player moves a card from their hand, chosen randomly, under this card.  Cards under this card have no text.
For each card under this card, add $50,000 to the total loot value of all case cards in play.

cards.title: Return Visit
body: Destroy 2 Hero ongoing cards.
In descending order of loot value, put into play the {H - 2} Case cards with the highest loot values from among the Case cards in the Villain trash.

flavorQuotes.text: You'd think they would have changed{BR}their security since last time...
